website_summaries.verdict: This value-priced weed eater by DEWALT is efficient and durable.
pros: Weed eater weighs only 8.5 pounds, making it easy to maneuver
Hi-Lo speed options allow you to adjust control based on your environment
cons: String tends to break off very easily

customer_reviews.title: Revised review: I feel cheated and scammed!!
customer_reviews.text: There is literally no reason for a homeowner to own a gas trimmer with a product like this. We have an acre and I have never ran out of power before I was finished. Revision as of 7/16/2017:After a year of light use the weedeater died today. Turns out the 3 year warranty doesnt cover the motor and it is a very common problem known by Dewalt. I have been a dewalt guy my entire life but I feel taken advantage of this time. I want my $179 back.
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: Not the usual DEWALT reliability at all
customer_reviews.text: Big dewalt fan but this is through and through a piece of garbage. I've only used it about six times on a 1/4 acre area (driveway / sidewalk / flower beds) and it just seized up to the point that the motor wasn't turning fast enough to cut a blade of grass. To top it off the 2nd time I sent it in for warranty repair they CHARGED me $50+!! The explanation is that it is a 3 year cost control warranty - not actually a 3 year guarantee.
customer_reviews.author: Diane E

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to remove line spool
customer_reviews.text: We have used a lot of string trimmers, but this one is awful. It worked well at first, but when I went to replace the line, I found out that the spool simply would NOT remove. We tried for more than an hour. The manual for this model number had instruction for a unit that looked very different than the one that I got. Somehow, the instructions for the model that was delivered to me are not available anywhere. The heads are wildly different. Not sure if I got some kind of prototype never meant for mass production or what, but this is a huge disappointment from DeWalt.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it didn't
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 3/20/16 quit working 8/16/18 - local warranty center does not work on them. Warranty center gave me the number for a service center that would work on it, which is more than two hours away. Called warranty center and was told the 3-year warrant would not cover any repairs, there is only a ONE year warranty for service. With the cost of shipping and repairs, it would be cheaper to buy a new one. Piece of junk & no real warranty - buy something else. I'm very disappointed in Dewalt.
customer_reviews.author: Guest

customer_reviews.title: Junk--Very disappointed in Dewalt
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this trimmer less than 4 months ago and it has received light use. Now, it will come on, turn a couple of times, and stop. Upon calling Dewalt, for this relatively new product, I was told I could either send it in, and wait a month to get it back while the weeds take over the yard, or drive 40 minutes away to an authorized repair location...and waste whatever time it takes to address it in that way. I am a very dissatisfied customer to say the least. **Update: Dewalt contacted me to say they will be sending a replacement! I will update the review based on the performance of the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is so nice to just grab the Dewalt and go
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer works really well. I have an acre and the 5 amp battery lasts the entire yard. I keep it in the low setting for the majority of time because that is all that is needed. Sometimes flip it to high for tall stuff. Not as strong as my gas Stihl but that is a pain to use being gas and noisy. It is so nice to just grab the Dewalt and go. I hate trimming but between the Dewalt and the gas I opt for the brushless quiet battery one. I find I will trim more often than I would with the gas just because I hated the chore of the messy noisy gas one.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Junk-save your money and buy a cheaper one that will last
customer_reviews.text: This item was purchased in October of 2015 and now in August of 2016 it is already broken the motor has locked up.. What a piece of junk.. You would think with a name like dewalt you would get something of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie M.

customer_reviews.title: Very good product.
customer_reviews.text: I am quite pleased with my DeWalt weed eater. It is a bit heavier than advertised in the item write-up, about 13# but I am not having any problems handling it. This was important to me since I am a 72 year old female trying to keep up with the yard work. Do wish the guard was wider to keep it from throwing things back onto my legs!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer.

customer_reviews.title: I use the low speed setting to trim along chain-link fence and it does not rip the line off; which is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid it would be under powered and skeptical about battery life. It has hi and low mode. I use low to trim along chain-link fence and it does not rip the line off at that speed, which is awesome! I can trim one side of 1/3rd acre of fence, 13 trees, around house, and kids play equipment 1.5 times on one charge. In the hi setting, it has all the power you need for heavy weed stalks. I think the 40 amp trimmer would be good for heavy clearing but for the average Joe this 20 amp trimmer is all you need.
customer_reviews.author: S Stork

customer_reviews.title: Messed up after 20 minutes use
customer_reviews.text: The string/wire got tangled up after 20 minutes and I can;t figure out how to fix it. I can't find anyway to release the spool. Ready to throw it away because my chainsaw was garbage and I never even got to use it ONCE!!! Dewalt tools are a waste of money and I used top be a fan. I'm not an America is best at everything type but it's all disposable Chinese crap now and I paid a lot for these tools! I had better luck with a $79 trimmer. It has a lot of power but if the string tangles all the time it;s worthless!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cary Howe

customer_reviews.title: Not so durable and very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased @ June 2015. It only lasts less two seasons. The motor was dead but battery still good. Going nowhere by calling DeWalt support number.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Having owned only gasoline powered trimmers I was skeptical as to whether cordless was the way to go. I am no longer skeptical. This machine is a beast. The one drawback I see so far is the lack of balance. The head placed quite a load on your lead hand. I will try to relocate the handle, but I would recommend buying a 6AH or bigger Battery to counterweight the head, and fashioning a shoulder strap, otherwise, I am impressed, this machine has plenty of torque to tackle most trimming tasks.
customer_reviews.author: James H. Agans

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable junk weed trimmers, Beware!!
customer_reviews.text: Did not last even one season. Total piece of junk. I would estimate maybe 6 hours of light use total before it just quit. Was very happy with dewalt until purchase. Was told by "customer support" I would have to take to service center a few hundred miles away. Good bye Dewalt. Was happy with you until you started selling junk.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Solid and powerful
customer_reviews.text: Based on my short time with the DeWalt trimmer, it is well balanced and fairly powerful for a battery driven device. My wife thinks it is a bit heavy for extended use, but it's actually on the lighter side of trimmers. So far the battery has been good for trimming around our half acre lot. The two speeds are a nice feature, and most grasses and weeds can easily be trimmed on the slower speed which also increases battery life. Of course the bonus of being able to use the 20V DeWalt batteries is also great (if you have other DeWalt cordless power tools). I am happy with my purchase and overall quality.
customer_reviews.author: TXZeus

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt trimmer plus battery combo
customer_reviews.text: Bought this with battery. Charged battery fully, and have now trimmed my yard three times on a single charge. Love this model. I did have to adjust the handle for better balancing, but that was easy with wrench provided. Can only find two minor flaws: (1) cutting guard is way too narrow and (2) you have to clean the top of motor head after each use to prevent the vents from plugging up. These are minor when comparing to the tugging on gas powered cords and the noise they make. Don’t over think it, just get it. It’s quiet and does great job. I plan to get the blower next!
customer_reviews.author: John V. Adamson

customer_reviews.title: Good product but need to immediately replace the head
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a decent product but the head that comes with this Trimmer is worthlessness. If you buy this Trimmer, be sure and also order DEWALT DWO1DT980 Trimmer Head then trash the other head. I am very disappointed with Dewalt for designing such a poor component to this otherwise good product. They should give those of us who had to replace the head so that it will function properly a credit for the replacement head.
customer_reviews.author: T. Giles

customer_reviews.title: works great for normal sized yards
customer_reviews.text: I have a larger yard with fencing all the way around and I have to use two batteries to do it all. On the second battery I tend to have overheating issues where the motor won't spin. Works great for the entire first battery and half the second battery. It trims great, easy to restring, easy to bump out more line, nice and light. So if you have a normal sized yard that you can do with around one battery it will be a perfect trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: K. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced at nearly $300.
customer_reviews.text: I think I paid more for the name brand than I should have. The line that comes with the trimmer breaks if you look at if funny. Fortunately, I had some other line on the shelf that met the manufacturer's spec. The other line is outlasting the OEM line considerably. I wish it came with a wheel for easy sidewalk edging. The trimmer has 2 power levels and a variable speed trigger switch. I like that so I can work harder if I need to. Well made, but overpriced by half.
customer_reviews.author: labicicleta

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed  !
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for the the first time that I used it , but a week later. I tried to use it again , and it would run for only a second or two. I thought that the battery was discharged , so I swapped in a fresh one , no difference. I took it to a local repair shop , which sent it to the main DeWalt center in Orlando. Fl..and they sent me a new one ! Two weeks later , I had the exact same problem with the new one ! 😡 I wanted to send it back too , but Covid 19 shut down the repair center indefinitely !
customer_reviews.author: mario

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Dewalt and Black and Decker is the same company, but they're not sharing technology. There's no Dewalt option to get a trimmer with an edger built in. Also, Black and Decker has the auto-feed string which is fantastic and Dewalt doesn't seem to offer that, either. Dewalt is also not offering a reasonably priced replacement string cartridge, which Black and Decker has. You have to wind it yourself, and it jams up constantly. Bumping and feeding is a pain in the neck, too. Dewalt's battery technology is better than Black and Decker. That's why I stick with it. But I tell ya, I wish there was more competition.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon D. Macqueen

customer_reviews.title: Worst trimmer I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is the worst performing string trimmer I have ever owned. Bump advance is pretty much worthless because line gets stuck inside head and won’t advance. Line frequently breaks off inside head and results in more time fixing line than actual trimming. I bought this hoping for ease of trimming and more power. To my disappointment, my lower priced 19.2 Craftsman trimmer and Worx trimmer perform better without the added frustration of always fixing the line.
customer_reviews.author: 69rebel

customer_reviews.title: Four years of heavy use and still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 4 years ago. It is used almost every day during the summer for the yard, ditches, around trees and under fence lines. If you have a lot of weed eating to do I would recommend an extra battery if you're going to go for long periods. I prefer short amounts of time every day rather a big long marathon session. I got this because I HATE starting gas powered ones and I haven't been disappointed. It runs great, starts without fail, is lighter and less noisy and smelly than it's gas counterpart. The string is a pain to reload (that's why I detracted a star) but my husband handles that so it's not an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Used once, battery died in 5 minutes after a week of charging
customer_reviews.text: I was unimpressed with the low power setting while weed eating so I put it on high. The 20 AH battery died in less than 5 minutes of total use time. I let it charge for a week before use. I have an average sized yard in a neighborhood. I got half of my front yard done and had to quite due to the battery (it literally died after doing the sidewalks and half my driveway.) I sent it back and will be getting a gas powered weed eater. I should have known better than to go with a battery powered yard tool.
customer_reviews.author: Family Man

customer_reviews.title: Showed up not working
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and finally got a chance to use to to come and find it is defective. Sting won’t release she tapped. I tried many times to remove sting and refill the spook. There seems to be an issue with the housing itself. Seller was zero help I wouldn’t recommend buying from them. I’ll just go to home depot next time. Oh wait I will just go to Home Depot because I still need a weed trimmer that works
customer_reviews.author: jj2000`

customer_reviews.title: Love this lighter weight trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This lightweight trimmer meets all my expectations. I have a bad back and the gasoline powered trimmers, though good trimmers, are more difficult for me to use because of the weight. The Dewalt is much easier for me to use and does an excellent job trimming. In fact, the line is better and lasts longer than on the gas powered trimmers I’ve used. Plus I no longer have to mess with mixing oil and gas. The battery has an acceptable life and I have a fairly big yard with lots of fence and flower beds.
customer_reviews.author: WFT

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I have several other Dewalt 20v max products and figured it was time to cut the cord on my electric Weedeater. We recently moved and have a little bigger yard, but still not too big. I just didn’t want to keep pulling around the extension cord and didn’t quite see the need for a gas Weedeater. My use is primarily trimming around the perimeter grass, not heavy weeds. This worked well for my application and I like that I can use the same batteries in my various tools.
customer_reviews.author: D_Tal16

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent periods of running
customer_reviews.text: Did not come with instruction manual! Took it out of the box and during the weedwacking it stopped for a few seconds and releasing and pressing the trigger again got it going Something may be wrong with it.. I’ll have to try again in a few weeks Shipper was fast
customer_reviews.author: Dog lover

customer_reviews.title: Loading string has gone back 20 years
customer_reviews.text: Good power and battery life if you can get the string loaded.. I've had several weed eaters over my lifetime and this is NOT DEWALT quality. They must have contracted this one out because it is the worst weed eater to load string on the market. I figure plastic head cover doesn't last the summer. This is not DEWALT quality. No WAY. I would not buy it again. I would not have purchased the first time had I know what I know now. Try it if you think I'm exaggerating but keep your receipt.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia A. Moir

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt makes excellent products
customer_reviews.text: This item is just what I needed, it works very well unless it's being used in thick and tall grass which causes the grass to get twisted around the shaft and bind the operation. it is light weight and well balanced. The straight shaft helps in storing the unit. The battery last a long time and recharges in a reasonable time. I own several Dewalt tools and found them to be very reliable. Shipment from the seller was quite fast and packed very well to avoid any possible damage.
customer_reviews.author: Paul S.

customer_reviews.title: Never again
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best purchased i have made. I will never go back to a gas operated trimmer. Fairly light and very easy to use. I don't even need it on High power it works great. I did change the trimmer head to one that I can put three strands on by puling them thru the loop. See  The trimmer head that it came with promptly left me with one strand instead of two and It is not fun at all to replace the trimmer line.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Bittenbender

customer_reviews.title: No more  ,gas Oil or pulling! And so quiet!
customer_reviews.text: Wow it’s so nice not to have to mess with gas and oil. I have a 5 ah battery and it last about an hour just enough to get all my trimming done on one charge. I have noticed a slight sag in the middle where the 2 sections of the bar go together but doesn’t seem to be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: East Coast Okie

customer_reviews.title: Great Aleternative to gas
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this trimmer last year here on Amazon. I have not had one problem with the unit. The charge lasts more then long enough for me to do the front and back yards (about 1/2 acre) - plus I also use this at our seasonal campsite to cut down taller grass along the creek in back - it does the job. Restringing the line is a little cumbersome but after you do it once or twice it goes quite smoothly. This thing is whisper quiet, no issues so far. So, if you are a homeowner I recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars except for....
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this trimmer except for the worthless brush guard. It is too small and doesn't do anything to protect you no matter how you hold it. Would give it 5 stars but the brush guard is killing me every time I use it. Battery life with 5ah battery is great. I can get through 1/2 acre trimming and edging with battery to spare. Quality product just need to do something about the guard. That said though.. I do recommend the trimmer.. just wear pants and protective glasses.
customer_reviews.author: W R

customer_reviews.title: For trimming only - NOT FOR EDGING
customer_reviews.text: Before reading fine print in instructions, edging was tried and proved to be almost impossible. If you need to do edging also, do not expect this machine to do it. Instructions say "DO NOT USE FOR EDGING". Also, unit has poor screening to protect motor from debris in the cooling air stream. Grass clippings can easily plug off the cooling air.
customer_reviews.author: Proton Dave

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on July 29th 2018 , as of today the motor has quit turning , its only used around the house for about a hour every other week , I still have the original spool of Dewalt trimmer line that was bought with it looks to be about half of it left grrrrr . Not such a good deal after all a gas trimmer for $75 is a better deal in the long run ..
customer_reviews.author: Rodney

customer_reviews.title: ... to admit after using it myself it was a good buy. Fairly light weight and lasts a surprisingly ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased this to go along with his other yard tools by Dewalt and I have to admit after using it myself it was a good buy. Fairly light weight and lasts a surprisingly long time on one charge. I am pretty short but it is still comfortable to for me to use. So if you are 5.2 don't worry you can handle it with ease!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for a woman
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this for myself,it was easy to put together. I charged the battery which was pretty quick. I'm impressed with the power this had on low as far as cutting ability. I didn't keep track of how long I was using it but I can tell you that when I was ready to quit so was the battery. Very pleased even after a couple of uses,my husband was also impressed with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: D. Todd

customer_reviews.title: My husband really didn't like to drag the cord around on the electric toro
customer_reviews.text: My husband really didn't like to drag the cord around on the electric toro. Don't doubt me for a moment, the Toro was an excellent machine if you didn't mind dragging the cord around but the dewalt cordless weed wacker made it ENJOYABLE for that cumbersome task. We loaned it to our neighbor & she was smitten with it...she said she had to get one of those ...so we bought her one. Wouldn't you know it she was happy as a clam 😎
customer_reviews.author: FIGJAM

customer_reviews.title: A very good product.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for one season and love it. It is versatile, and balanced. It does a great job. The battery lasts past any amount of time I have used it. The shield is properly placed to protect you from flying debris. There are so many options out there, and this is the right one. My neighbor has had one for years and loves it. I could not pass up that endorsement.
customer_reviews.author: CoachDave

customer_reviews.title: Most Powerful Battery Operated tool I ever Used!
customer_reviews.text: For a Battery Operated String Trimmer, has just as much Power as my gas trimmers. I was Very Impressed! There is a Slight Problem with the Trimmer head, If you run at High Speed, and your Not Cutting Large weeds, it tends to cut the line and only one sting is out, and that throws it out of Balance. So I restrung it, Put it on Low Speed, and didn't have a Problem after that, and cuts just as good! Only use High Speed for Weeds like Golden Rod and tough things like that. Also, That String, The Dewalt String, Is Some Very TOUGH STUFF! Strongest String I ever had!!!! Very Nice!
customer_reviews.author: Keith W. Kitchen Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Good weedeater, but like most it has it warts.
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of power, however the line does get sucked back into the head pretty often when under use. I haven't restrung it yet so I'm not giving up hope that it'll be better after a restring.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Not the same product in the picture!
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer does not have the same head shown in the picture. False advertising. Works ok but this is not a dual string head. Even the manual does not match the product. 😡
customer_reviews.author: James McLean

customer_reviews.title: 3 years and it is dead
customer_reviews.text: This has worked great on a small yard. I sold my industrial strength weed whacker to go with less fuel use around the home but it appears that nothing can outlast a properly cared for gas device. Purchased 8/5/2017 - Died (motor likely) on 9/28/2020 It's death is disappointing as I need to take to a shop perhaps? Why 1 star? It did not last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent product from dewalt
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, however I was holding back money when I purchased it, I would buy the 40 volt for more power. This last roughly 45 mins on low setting, maybe 30 mins on high setting. For regular grass it's fair. For thick weeds 40v version. This struggles with thicker weeds requires multiple passes to do damage.
customer_reviews.author: Andy B

customer_reviews.title: Gas powered sucks buy this you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.text: Frikin awesome! Can't recommend anything more then this guy, it powers through everything and very easy to use I'm glad i bought the 5ah battery with it bc it saved me ~45 bucks and it'll last for 2 or 3 uses on a 1/2 acre.. charged it maybe 4 times all summer and i don't have to worry about winterizing it! Gasoline is such a pain never going back!
customer_reviews.author: James Briede

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Another great DeWalt product! I love how quiet it is, I can edge my yard without waking neighbors and finish mowing early in the day. I rated the 'lightweight' category with 4 stars since this isn't really a lightweight tool. But maybe I am just weak, idk. Very happy with the tool though!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weed wacking
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned the battery life wouldn’t last the job and I’d have to keep more batteries around. Not only did the battery last, I was able to use the battery in my DeWalt leaf blower afterwards. This weed wackier was able to tackle my overgrown backyard with no problem, and with power to spare. I’m very, very happy with this purchase. I would recommend this for the homeowner, but not for a landscaping business.
customer_reviews.author: Edward C.

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt should be ashamed to put their name on this.
customer_reviews.text: TOTAL POS! The self feeding trimmer line feature is a joke. I've only use dit for 15 min and that feature stopped working It's complete junk plastic that can't be repaired or taken apart. The instructions suck. I have had this for over 30 days so now I'm stuck with this plastic chinese POS.
customer_reviews.author: Duane H.

customer_reviews.title: I mowed down my whole yard (small yard and not good for a mower) in 20 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Was a lifelong Stihl user but my cousin was praising the Dewalt Chainsaw. I bought this because I thought it would be quiet, be able to knock down thick grass, and turnkey. This trimmer performed fully to my expectations and beyond. I mowed down my whole yard (small yard and not good for a mower) in 20 minutes. It uses all the battery power up until it completely dies (i.e. doesn't lose performance as the battery drains out). Very impressed with the device. Also, there are two options (with a battery and without a battery). Some people bought this not realizing it came/did not come with a battery. Make sure you are buying the right one.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Heck

customer_reviews.title: No gas to mix! Battery seems to last forever!
customer_reviews.text: My experience with trimmers has always been gas powered, having most of the weight at the other end of the trimmer is hard to get used to. Other than that, love it! I have a .30 acre lot and so far, I’ve trimmed my whole property once a week for 6 weeks on one charge and haven’t had to charge it. Plus I can always use my dewalt drill batteries if I have to while the primary battery charges! So far I’m liking the all electric change a lot. No gas to mix!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Moroney

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, but failed after less than 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer worked great, but guess what? The electric motor failed in less than 6 months. The "brushless contactor" self destructed and locked it up. This appears to me to be a weak point that can overheat and "melt" if the vent screen gets plugged with debris. (The vent screen WILL get plugged with debris, it's a weed wacker!) I fear this could cause all these to fail in this manner eventually, but that's just my opinion. Very disappointed in DeWalt, have had very good service out of other DeWalt tools.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Shuler

customer_reviews.title: Did not get the correct head.
customer_reviews.text: I like the unit fine except for the string replacement. It looks like an old Black & Decker I used to have. Does not come close to the picture on the web site. Went to parts warehouse and diagrams for this model do not match.
customer_reviews.author: JERRY PAULSON

customer_reviews.title: My favorite weed whacker ever! Still works great years later!!
customer_reviews.text: So far, this is my favorite weed whacker ever. I've had b&d, makita, and many others and this is by far the best. Easy to start, plenty of power, great angle for trimming and edging, long battery use. All good. I would have given it five stars but the battery in the first one I got wouldn't hold a charge after 3 weeks. Amazon sent a new one and no problems at all so far with this battery. Update: I've had this weed whacker for several years now. I still love it and it is the best I have ever owned. If it ever breaks..I'm buying another one just like it!
customer_reviews.author: ohblahdi

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: very good battery life I can do my yard 3 times with one charge. It has the usual pain in the A** sting head I wish they would come up with something that works better and easier to change the string. The trimmer itself is light and easy to use. I like that I can use the battery for my Dewalt sawzaw also.
customer_reviews.author: Tinker

customer_reviews.title: Cutting head may be different from pictures
customer_reviews.text: Cons: Small cutting guard can leave you covered in grass, once you run to of line depending on which head you have it can be very hard to install new line and not have it constantly get stuck in head, READ OTHER REVIEWS. Pros: Great power batteries last a long time unit cuts like a bear quieter than some other trimmers
customer_reviews.author: Guysair

customer_reviews.title: I lost my Dewalt cordless trimmer to my Daughter.
customer_reviews.text: She loves it. No hard starting. The single battery generally lasts as long as she does and since I've torn out a bunch of shrub stumps and tree stumps at her place the string doesn't wear out so quickly. The down side is now I have to buy another for myself.
customer_reviews.author: notfishing

customer_reviews.title: Read the negative reviews!
customer_reviews.text: I have a shop that's full of DeWalt tools, and I really like the brand. In reading the Amazon reviews for this string trimmer, some of the bad ones were SO BAD that I didn't believe them - thinking they were disgruntled employees or competitors to DeWalt or something. I should have listened to their warnings. I used the product for five minutes and couldn't wait to re-box it and return it. Uncomfortable to use and string broke and needed to be re-spooled in about 30 feet. So disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Caffey

customer_reviews.title: Solid build, poor guard
customer_reviews.text: Really good power and battery life. Solid build quality. My only complaint is with the guard. It’s too small and provides almost no protection from grass and debris flying back at your legs and sometimes even higher toward your face. You can’t weedwhack in shorts with this without a lot of pain or discomfort. DeWalt needs to improve the guard design. Otherwise, it’s a solid machine that I’m happy with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome machine just squeeze the triggers together once battery is in and go lasts over an hour for me. I really wish it was adapted for a strap with all my weeding it is a little heavy especially on my steep slopes the strap would help so much. I highly suggest not leaving the battery connected did that once and forgot picked it up and it took everything out around it. I love this thing! I’d buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Erica Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Headline
customer_reviews.text: Cuts grass well. I cut some pretty thick stuff and it hardly slowed down. The battery life seems very good. It is light and easy to maneuver. The guard is kinda small and will throw grass clippings around especially if you are not methodical about how you are attacking the weeds.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Most excellent Weed Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This DeWalt trimmer is an excellent trimmer. The battery lasts a long time with no issues with heavy grass or weeds. I have a 1 acre yard with a lot of edging and this trimmer does it well. It is lightweight and easy to handle. The battery is quick to change and charges rapidly. Worth the money. I won't go back to a gas trimmer again.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Perkins

customer_reviews.title: NEED GORILLA HANDS
customer_reviews.text: YOU NEED GORILLA HANDS.....I have large hands, you really need them to rewind spool. My old weedeater I can replace a spool in 2 seconds. I love and have many dewalt tools.....it took me five minutes to rewind the spool. Fire the guy who designed this, bump head. Few women could ever do this.
customer_reviews.author: glenn auman

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Cuts well and is easy to load string. Note: after loading string and replacing spool cover. Looking at the bottom of spool cover. You need keep the spool cover (or bottom) stationary. The notched gear just below the spool needs to turn counter clockwise.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Good DeWalt trimmer.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Not as light as I expected BUT I had major back surgery and it may just be my lack of fitness. We have lots of DeWalt products so we have batteries charging all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great while under warranty
customer_reviews.text: As soon as the warranty expired, so did the trimmer. Used it 3 years to trim my 300sqft yard for the 4 summer months we have, so maybe 12 times - very light use. Tried to use it this year and the motor is dead. Figure about $16.50 per use (paid $199 3 years ago) - not a very good value. I'll never buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: RSC

customer_reviews.title: Good product and saves lots of energy
customer_reviews.text: The trimmer head does not perform the auto bump trim line feed as specified. I like the big battery lots of power , no handling gas and hard to start issues like I’ve had w 6 previous trimmers over 30 years. Love the balance of it as well . I just have to hand adjust the line head to extend the string. Oh well hard to find absolute perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Turman

customer_reviews.title: Love at first sight
customer_reviews.text: I will NEVER use a gas trimmer again after using this baby! LOVE the fact that I don't have to get blisters trying to start it, like I did with the gas trimmer. Also love that I can stop it and set it down while trimming (e.g. if I have to move a stick or rock) and I can just keep going. I have had to rethread the string several times, so that's been a bit of a bother. I hope this thing holds up - it's been discouraging reading the reviews about it conking out after a period of time...
customer_reviews.author: A. Denton

customer_reviews.title: It's a solid tool and I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this trimmer. Two misses: -I wish is that the head could pivot for easier sidewalk edging. -The trimmer string it comes with is garbage. Upgrade the string right away. Power is very strong and I use it on the slower speed which is adequate for my blue grass. It's a solid tool and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Rednarb

customer_reviews.title: Weed it.
customer_reviews.text: The max battery that came with it can out last me in the Texas heat. I use it for some really tough weeds and grasses no problem. The only thing I don't like is winding the string. I had to trim the end to almost a point and bend it with needle nose pliers to form a little hook to get it started. There is probably an easier way, but I could not find it on the internet. Anyway, once wound it worked just as good as when I bought it. At 8 lbs with the battery it is a bit heavier than my older B and D, but it cuts better. .
customer_reviews.author: Virginia70

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life and light weight
customer_reviews.text: I have the big Flex battery in and it is still heavy on the trimmer side. Only annoying when carrying, it is great when actually trimming. The string it comes with is flimsy and gets chewed up really quickly against my landscape wall. I will try the ones I have left from my old gas trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but excellence as usual from Dewalt
customer_reviews.text: Dewalt does it again for me! I started using their products about 2 years ago and have been very satisfied with their tools and warranty. This trimmer is all is says it is, excellent. Great build quality, quiet, long lasting battery, light weight and powerful. I especially like the two speed option it has, very nice. As has been mentioned, a shoulder strap should be included which would really make this a primo unit. I had a small issue which their Customer Service was quick to resolve for me. This was the first time I've ever had to contact them for any of my tools.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Thank u amazon for good price and dewalt for solid weed
customer_reviews.text: If u have 20v drill it's a defanite thing to get. Even if u don't this is much more quite than regular weed eaters. This is also way lighter which is huge benafit when sweating to death after mowing. This model comes with the big 5 amp battery and a charger which makes it worth getting if don't have dewalt drills. I can get my front and back yard on one battery. Thank u amazon for good price and dewalt for solid weed eater
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: This is a game changer light weight, no chord, no gas, no struggling to start, hook up a battery and away you go. Powerful, great battery life but have a backup, so easy to use, would highly recommend. Absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.author: William Striby

customer_reviews.title: NO more gas or repairs
customer_reviews.text: After 20 years of using gas powered expensive trimmers, and after years of having to to take it to have the carb rebuilt at 60 to 80 dollars a year and paying for the additives and Ethanol free gas, I am pleased to say ...I love it!!! Weighs less, Runs about 40 min on setting 1 and 20 min on setting 2...high. Would agree...the line it comes with is junk. NO more yearly bills to repair, no more gas and oil to mix, no more pulling and pulling and pulling to get it to start.... PS it also has a variable speed trigger
customer_reviews.author: P Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Good to go. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Battery last fairly long on low and low is powerful enough to get most things done if your yard isn’t a jungle. Hi eats battery kinda fast but really thrashes large stuff. All in alll it’s worth it. I can do our small yard a few times on a charge.
customer_reviews.author: tyler haselhorst

customer_reviews.title: it really adds the extra time and power you need for things like the skill saw and sawzall
customer_reviews.text: Way more power and battery lasts longer than I expected too. I have a smallish front and back yard, so I run it for about 45 min. Def get the 5Ah with it, it is cheaper than buying it separately and if you have other 20v tools, it really adds the extra time and power you need for things like the skill saw and sawzall.
customer_reviews.author: ITGuru

customer_reviews.title: Decent string trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This is a good trimmer for a small yard. Only has about 30 minutes of run time on high setting with the 5 amp battery that comes with it. I would recommend getting the bigger shield cause this trimmer throws a lot of debris.
customer_reviews.author: Armyguy8382

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life so far
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, can do entire yard - 1/4 lot with average gardens, and sidewalk (do both sides of sidewalk and along curb) with one battery. Sturdy line. On 2nd spool after 4 jobs. Line hung up in spool twice so far - a bit of a pain to remove the head and clear, but this is endemic to trimmers in general. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie P.

customer_reviews.title: A Great Tool - Very Handy
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is very convenient. The tool is powerful and has little or no vibration and noise as compared to a gas trimmer. Threading a new line on the spool is simplified with the Dewalt trimmer head.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Go battery! Save yourself the headache...
customer_reviews.text: It's soooo convenient not to have to use gasoline, less mess, no frustration getting cans filled, and mixing. Highly recommend going battery powered. Just wish the charge would last a tad bit longer. I have 3/4 acre and it just finishes the job.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Rusch

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: this is my first battery powered piece of lawn equipment and i love it. it is so much easier to use. doesn’t smell, don’t need gas cans i. the garage and is not as loud. it is a little heavier than i expected but i still hope to convert all my lawn equipment to battery.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew B.

customer_reviews.title: it turns out to be good fun! This whacker seems to be very well ...
customer_reviews.text: I used to scoff at people who bothered to weed whack, but hey, it turns out to be good fun! This whacker seems to be very well made. I have no problems with the battery life, and it has definitely cleaned up all the spots where my mower can't go, some of which were starting to get pretty jungley. The feeder is good. So far it has clogged only once, and it wasn't too hard to take it apart and rewrap the cord. I did remove the little piece of metal that keeps the max cord length so short.

customer_reviews.title: Batteries are finally there.....
customer_reviews.text: After having a finicky gas powered trimmer for years I decided to try this out. There is plenty of power and duration to make this a great replacement for gas. Plenty of power in normal mode though in most cases I can run this on low power mode. Great trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: John Albanese

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: On the low speed setting I can finish off my 1/3 acre property with battery life to spare. I love the button on the battery that tells you how much charge is left. My only complaint is that it's rather top heavy at the handle, otherwise it's a great trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: the battery drained after a half an hour but the weeds were the worst I've seen and I had a second battery
customer_reviews.text: got this delivered Saturday morning and proceeded to cut down 4 foot high weeds for 8 hours on Saturday and 4 more hours on sunday. the battery drained after a half an hour but the weeds were the worst I've seen and I had a second battery. On the second day I was able to get twice as much coverage in the 30 minute battery life and that coverage far exceeded anything I have seen with other weed eaters. this thing gets the job done! btw, I covered over an acre of 4ft high weeds in 12 hours of constant running of the machine.
customer_reviews.author: roy key

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: I love my DEwalt trimmer it does the job without skipping a beat !! I'm not crazy about how you have to put the new string on and honestly if I had known that I probably would not have bought it, I like the one where you just pop the line out and pop the new one in!!
customer_reviews.author: clearview2

customer_reviews.title: My favorite trimmer. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: So happy to never again have to put 2-stroke oil and fuel into my trimmer, and never again have to anticipate the noise, smell and grease when I'm preparing to pull it off the shelf and get the thing started. I also have the blower that uses the same battery. This thing is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Works great, needs a sholder strap
customer_reviews.text: Like this so much more than my old gas powered version but it could really use a shoulder strap for support.
customer_reviews.author: LarryLars

customer_reviews.title: It's just a better solution...
customer_reviews.text: While I remain curious about longevity vs. my Stihl equipment so far so good and I certainly don't miss the noise and associated nuisance of the engine. So far, in my experience, electric is the best way to go for the average homeowner.
customer_reviews.author: wademan

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as I wanted. Cordless, with a ...
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as I wanted. Cordless, with a rechargeable battery pack, which gives me freedom of range and no wrestling with cords. Electric battery also means no more messing with 2-stroke, spark plugs, and trying to start an uncooperative gasoline engine. And this device is stingy on dispensing cord; you tap it on the ground to make it dispense additional line, but it otherwise sticks with what you let out, and no more. Numerous competitive models just spew line carelessly, making you go through spool after spool.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Battison

customer_reviews.title: No more pull, pull, pull starting (or not) again!
customer_reviews.text: Works better than I expected any battery trimmer could. Lightweight AND powerful! Never again will I pull, pull, pull start (or not) a string trimmer. Plenty of battery life for my 1/2 acre fenced yard. I used it, and afterwards the battery "fuel gauge" didn't even move. Its well built and I expect to get many years of service from it, and I wont worry about fuel stabilizer! This is the one to buy if you are considering a battery trimmer! I own several other DeWalt 20V tools and they really stand up to my use (abuse).
customer_reviews.author: Richard Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: I was fed up with my 2 stroke gas trimmer constantly breaking down and taking 20+ minutes to get started. Decided to give an electric a try and so far so good. It is not as powerful as a gas trimmer so don't think it will compair in that way, however I am pleased with its performance. I used it today and was able to do the exact same job as my gas trimmer in half the time without all the effert and discomfort. At this point I recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Alex M

customer_reviews.title: New trimer
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time and I works great I have two acres and the battery will do half. 1st the season I trimmed and has some very high grass. Used the low setting most of the time and only used high setting in the tall grass I did buy extra batteries and how I think I will be looking at a leaf blower. The nice thing about this it starts every time you touch the switch
customer_reviews.author: Jerrel

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying My Trimming
customer_reviews.text: Finally enjoying trimming again. Cordless is the best. Battery last as long as I need to finish what I need to do before needing to recharge. Unit is balanced well for this old lady. So much that we ordered this one for the neighbor
customer_reviews.author: D. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to shift away from gas models
customer_reviews.text: Easy assemble. Will be easy to reload string. Good power. In my 1/2 acre lot it lasted 35 minutes. I was 90 percent done. Getting a second 5AH battery is next.
customer_reviews.author: fritz kocher

customer_reviews.title: Extended warranty
customer_reviews.text: Quit on me after 1.5 years. Maybe used 20-30 times on an average yard. Was weed eating. Just stopped turning after 10minutes. Put spare battery on and same thing. Get an extended warranty. Never fed line right, but easy to shut off and manual feed.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Definitely up to the task
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful and quality construction. Don't know how I got such a good deal, but it is well worth the price. Serious long term power and structural strength built in. I would expect that from DeWalt, and they did not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph S. Keen

customer_reviews.title: Defective Unit
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 52 days ago. DeWalt Box says 90 free return policy but Amazon says 30 days. I used it twice and charged it once. Now doesn't work at all.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce W. Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: Works for a while
customer_reviews.text: Worked great the first few times I used it. It sat around until this spring when I needed it again and when I went to use it, no power. It turns but Its like its on low speed all the time. Switch the low-high switch and nothing happens. I have several dewalt 20v tools and they are all great. I tested the battery in them so its not the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Mattiearthur

customer_reviews.title: trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I like the light weight trimmer. As it is battery operated there is no trouble starting like with a gas operated trimmer..I bought 2 extra batteries as I have large yard
customer_reviews.author: The old man

product_meta.title: DEWALT DCST920P1 Brushless Trimmer
product_meta.description: Max Lithium Ion XR trimmer provides precise power control with a variable speed trigger as well as performance & run time management with a Hi/lo speed control switch. Brushless motor maximizes motor efficiency & durability. Patented gear drive design provides more torque & maintains cut speed under load. Dual 0.080 in. Line with bump feed clears 13 in. Includes: 20V Max 5Ah Lithium Ion battery, charger, auxiliary handle, guard, & .080 in. Line rewound in spool. This product is Manufactured in China. This product meets customer requirement.
feature_bullets: Brushless Motor maximizing motor efficiency and durability
Dual 0.080" line with bump feed, with 13-inch cutting swath
Patented gear drive design. Rpm: 0-4,600 / 0-6,000 rpm
Includes 20V MAX 5.0Ah Lithium Ion Battery, along with charger

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,433 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
